contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 30, 2018 D SCABA Autumn Contest (B Section)
SCABA Autumn Contest (B Section) 1 Hymn & Own Choice Test Piece Contest SCABA Autumn Contest scaba-autumn-contest-b-section
The Hawth, Crawley, West Sussex Combined Section for Youth, 3rd and 4th Section bands.
Best Hymn Tune: Shanklin Best Conductor: James Haigh, Godalming Best Instrumentalist: Christine Nonoo (Euphonium), Hangleton
Best Cornet or Flugel: Richard Taylor (cornet), Hangleton Best Tenor Horn: Charlotte Lewis, Shanklin Best Baritone: Sam Honeysett, Godalming Best Euphonium: Robin Langdon, Cobham Best Back Row Cornets: Brighton & Hove Best Trombones: Godalming Best Basses: Godalming Best Percussion: Godalming
Highest placed Ungraded band: Cobham Highest placed Youth band: Hangleton Youth Highest Placed 4th Section band: Godalming Highest Placed 3rd Section band: Brighton & Hove
Sept. 9, 2018, 3:01 p.m. Oct. 1, 2018, 3:34 p.m.
1 Godalming Band James Haigh Vitae Aeternum
2 Brighton and Hove City Brass Matthew Hackett Triptych [Sparke]
3 Shanklin Town Brass Malcolm Lewis St. Andrews Variations [Fernie]
4 Hangleton Band Richard A. Baker The Pacemakers
5 Epping Forest Band Keith Schroeter Lyonesse
6 Cobham Band Glenn Hayter Spiritual Sounds
7 Hangleton Youth Richard A. Baker A Northumbrian Suite
